intro: Trizeuxis discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered spiderwort, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and slightly hairy. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and range in color from white to pale blue, often with a yellow throat. Trizeuxis discolor is noted for its ability to thrive in partial shade and its ornamental value in native plant gardens.
